intro: Oxalis candolleana, commonly known as the silver leaf oxalis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is characterized by its striking, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery-white coating. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Oxalis candolleana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
